intro: Mitrantia bilocularis, commonly known as the two-chambered mitrantia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. Mitrantia bilocularis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
